title.narrative: Cofinancing of the Health Service Delivery Project for Mozambique

description.narrative: THE ULTIMATE OBJECTIVE OF MOZAMBIQUE'S HEALTH STRATEGY, AS DEFINED PARPA II and supported by this Project, is to improve the health status of the population by improving health service delivery so as to: (i) reduce child mortality; (ii) reduce maternal mortality; and (iii) reduce the burden of malaria, especially on vulnerable groups and other major diseases; (iv) reduce the prevalence of tuberculosis; and (iv) reduce inequity in the population#s access to health services. The specific objective of the project in the Northern provinces is to increase the coverage of health services by improving the population's access to health services in the three most disadvantaged provinces through: (i) strengthening community-based service delivery; (ii) scaling up outreach services; and (iii) improving and expanding facility-based services.
